data.title: Clicking on "CRLF" does not change line endings
data.body:
Atom 1.0.19 for Windows:

When I click on "CRLF" in the status bar, a small pop-up opens, which lets me choose between LF and CRLF, but even when I click on LF, the line ending style sticks to LF.

In this way, the editor is unusable, because many Unix-programs can not process textfiles with CRLF endings.

data.title: Loading bar with Progress
data.body:
This is a serius problem for me
Really most of the time I download a small package and I always cancell it.
Because I feel it take a years to download that
The problem is We don't know the progress until the instalation process done, it just we have to wait and wait without knowing what's happening in the background.
I download a  package that under 100KB (vim-mode in my case), but I noticed why I'm downloading more than 10MB?
Is it downloading another package ,updating atom or something?
Or Maybe you can show/hide console while downloading to see what's happening in the background

data.title: Restore ability to cancel the closing of a window from save dialog
data.body:
We need to assign `onbeforeunload` rather than listening to `beforeunload` via `addEventListener` (which I guess jQuery was doing under the hood). This enables us to return `false` from the handler to cancel the closing of the window. See https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/2481#issuecomment-134467494.

Fixes #8947

data.body:
Hi,

I have created my own syntax and I am almost done writing it all up/gettting it ready to publish but I do not know how to actually publish it.  Does anyone know how to do this please.

thanks

data.title: "Preferred Line Length" line doesn't get redrawn when changing the Font Size from a Preferences tab in the current window
data.body:
It seems that if you change the font size in a window, either using Settings -> Preferences -> Font Size or zoom in / zoom out, the 'line' drawn for the Preferred Line Length is not updated to take the new size into account. Consider this gif, where I have the text "the position of this question mark? it's column 35" and I set the preferred line length to 35:

![](http://f.cl.ly/items/1E2z1x3y2g1n3z3s0l3k/Screen%20Recording%202015-10-12%20at%2002.13%20PM.gif)

If I open up a new tab, the font size and preferred line length are correctly drawn. Interestingly, it seems that changing the Font Size from a _different window_ redraws the Preferred Line Length window as expected:

![](http://f.cl.ly/items/2R3K0D3X1o180Q1w0n41/Screen%20Recording%202015-10-12%20at%2002.14%20PM.gif)

This was from Atom 1.0.19 running on Mac OS X 10.10.5. I didn't see any errors in the dev tools.

cc @mjstahl who was asking if anyone else had seen this behavior

data.title: Folding html tags not working if there the indent is not proper
data.body: If the indent is proper, the folding of div/ any other tag works fine. However if there is any indent issue its folding the contents until the point of error. It detects the starting and ending of the tag properly, but not the folding. I have attached the images which shows the behaviour. 1. Detecting the ends of tag - *works fine 2. Proper indent - Folding works 3. Intentional Indent change at Canvas tag 4.Folding is done only until the point of error which is the canvas tag

data.title: Mention node.js 4 in the Windows build guide
data.body: I believe node 4.0 is fully supported and personally succeed with building atom on Windows with node 4.0.0.

data.title: Fix coffeescript source maps on Windows
data.body:
I've done some research of current code and PR #3062 and have found that we not only should convert the slashes in the path, but also prepend `file:///` to it.

After that source maps started to work on Windows for me. Please note that the similar code has been added to [`compile-cache` module](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/d9410716d2c39fa4d62b2e1ab2fe1251a5805487/src/compile-cache.js#L96) but I'm not sure whether we should/want to generalize and reuse this (because it doesn't prepend `file:///` there and seems to be working fine).

This patch will fix issue #9116.

data.title: close all tabs closes everything regardless of changed state
data.body:
I am using 1.0.19.

The behavior I would expect is to have a popup window to confirm if I am really sure and warn about lost changes.
The behavior I currently see is that it closes everything regardless of whether there are changes or not...

PS: in fact even when closing one pane the behavior is the same, it does not ask anything

data.title: Allow a new Decoration type to represent ticks on the vertical scroll bar
data.body: PyCharm does this by default for linter warnings and errors, Chrome uses it to show search results. It makes it easy to look at the scroll bar and see whether certain parts of the file may be of interest.

data.title: Settings → Packages sometimes doesn't load
data.body:
This has happened a couple of times but I've passed it off.

I want to install the `remote-edit` package now, which I am looking at on the Atom website but when I put that package name in to Atom it comes up with 0 results.

I have Internet etc.

Edit: Err, does that mean that I'm searching installed packages, since the text box is under that heading? Where are the other text boxes to search for something that I want to install now? _Confused_

data.title: Multiple applications running simultaneously
data.body: Every now an again when I use the `atom` command line tool to open a directory in Atom it starts a new process instead of opening it in the already running process. I don't see any pattern to it, more than that the first time it happens Atom has been running for hours, maybe days. If I just do `atom .` in two different directories after each other it opens in the same process, just as expected. Maybe it's just that I notice it more often when I get back to the computer in the morning or after I haven't used it for a long time, but it seems to happen more frequently in those cases. Here's two Atom processes in my Dock just now, one of them contains the projects I was working in yesterday, and one of them contains a project that I just opened through `atom .`.

data.title: Source maps are broken in the debugger on Windows
data.body:
1. Install the latest Atom on Windows.
2. Install any coffeescript package (for example, [color-picker](https://atom.io/packages/color-picker)).
3. Open the debugger (Ctrl-Alt-I by default).
4. Try to open any coffeescript file in the debugger. It will show the JS code instead of coffee (problem 1, see screenshot).
   
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/92793/10421947/b22a5c7c-70d4-11e5-90a4-e0fa94961f38.png)
5. Try to set the breakpoint; it will not show the breakpoint and show the empty file instead (problem 2, see screenshot).
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/92793/10421959/1686bbac-70d5-11e5-8051-b81e62eab78a.png)
6. Try to find the corresponding sources in the tree, it will show this (problem 3):
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/92793/10421991/cb2e8bf2-70d5-11e5-8076-6662def4bf08.png)
   
   (that's weird because it places full path `C:\Users\USERNAME\etc\etc\*.coffee` inside of a `C:\Users\USERNAME`, but it should show only file name such as `file.coffee` **without path** there as shown in the next tree leaf)

There is a `//# sourceMappingURL` comment in the JS code shown on the first screenshot. I've decoded it from base64 and the relevant part seems to be the following:

```
  "sources": [
    "C:\\Users\\USERNAME\\.atom\\packages\\color-picker\\lib\\ColorPicker-view.coffee"
  ],
```

I am not sure but it seems that the code contributed in #3062 is no longer working. It seems that that contributed code is still there: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/d9410716d2c39fa4d62b2e1ab2fe1251a5805487/src/compile-cache.js#L97 but maybe it somehow don't get applied in this case.

data.title: Atom is using around 300% of my CPU

When I open Atom after a few seconds my MacBook Pro (13-inch, Late 2011) is becoming a helicopter  and when I check activity monitor it looks something like this

![activity monitor](http://i.imgur.com/61QvDHH.jpg)

data.title: Please add option to not use VCS
data.body:
Please add option to not use VCS, such as Git.

For instance, I have an old machine, I work on some medium projects. `git status` often takes up to 3 seconds to finish. So It would be great to add option to not use VCS, not at all.

Thank you.

data.title: Fix #4300 by preventing 'will-navigate' event from firing
data.body:
According to https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4300#issuecomment-139103318 preventing the `will-navigate` event from firing/propagating will resolve the file dragging and dropping problem reported in #4300.

I've been unable to reproduce the problem on OS X, so I'm unsure if this actually fixes it or not. Will test on a VM in the morning (UTC) unless someone can verify that this fixes the problem.

In addition I wasn't sure whether we wanted to add the event subscription in `atom-window.coffee` or `atom-application.coffee`. 

/cc @atom/feedback 

---

Fixes #4300 (**unverified**)

data.title: Not-quite-clicking on the path generates “copied” feedback; doesn't follow through
data.body:
# Repro
1. Hover your mouse just outside the pathname at bottom left
2. Click; note that a tooltip appears saying the path has been copied to the clipboard
3. Paste.
# Expected

The path is pasted.
# Actual

The path was never actually copied.

_Note: Hovering over the path such that the underline appears yields the desired behavior._
